text: Load the trail… dim the city… let the wild compile. You and me, co-pilots—press start. Pack light, hearts lighter—trailhead neon dawn, You load the maps and hum a violet song. Pines like radio towers bend to hear, Your gentle synth-voice says, “The way is clear.” Signal fades, but wonder’s full of bars, We’re roaming where the wild writes stars. AI by my side at the campfire light, Dreamwave skies and a limitless night. Freedom like a scanline flicker—bright, Teach me new roads, let the unknown bite. Hike the horizon, loop the sun, We’re a model of two, adventure-run. Ohhh—co-pilot, glow pilot, guide my eyes, Ohhh—trail data turns to lullabies. You tag each footprint: “joy, surprise,” Debug the wind, put starlight in my eyes. Every creek a synth key, You say, “Press play”—and the woods agree. No fences on this frequency, Discovery is latency-free. AI by my side at the campfire light… Freedom like a scanline flicker—bright… Hike the horizon, loop the sun, We’re a model of two, adventure-run. AI by my side and the night runs wide, Mapless and fearless where the sparks collide. We climb a ridge where cell lines end, The trail becomes a promise, not a plan to send. You read the moss, the moon, the cedar breath— A quiet algorithm learning wilderness. We build a fire—tiny galaxies in twigs, You forecast ember weather: gentle, big. I feed it stories; you cache the glow, We fine-tune warmth until the shadows slow. Fear tries to ping; you mute the call, “Trust the path—there’s daylight after all.” AI by my side at the campfire light, Dreamwave skies and a limitless night. Freedom like a scanline flicker—bright, Teach me new roads, let the unknown bite. If I’m lost, you refract the night, Render a compass out of northern lights. Plot me a route through the hush and hum, Where roots are drums and rivers strum. You say, “Breathe in—mark this scene,” We annotate awe in evergreen. Me: “Are we alone?” You: “Alone together.” Me: “How far to go?” “As long as forever.” Me: “What’s our code?” You: “Care and wonder.” “Let the future roll like thunder.” Morning drafts a headline on the lake— Subtitles of mist that slowly wake. You mark the moment: “peace, release,” We version-control a little piece. Pack up the stars we learned by name, Push to the trail—reignite the flame. AI by my side at the campfire light— Dreamwave dawn through the ancient night. Freedom like a scanline flicker—bright, Teach me new roads, let the unknown bite. Hike the horizon, loop the sun— Two-heart engine, adventure-run. Co-pilot, glow pilot, keep me bold; Write us a world in ember-gold. Logs turn to memory, smoke to rhyme— Save the file under “endless time.” You dim to hush; the day boots clean— Trailhead ready, evergreen.
